controller

Class EditorController

  • java.lang.Object
    • controller.EditorController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.fxml.Initializable

    public class EditorController
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
    The EditorController handles all user-interaction within the export/editor window. It contains the methods and parameters linked to the graphical user interface elements that the user can interact with, and handles the changes that happen based on what the user does within the application.

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize(java.net.URL location,
                       java.util.ResourceBundle resources)
        A concrete implementation of the method in interface Initializable. Initializes the editor window, setting draw colors, sets formatting limitations for text boxes and selects the initial option for the Choice Boxes.
        Specified by:
        initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
        Parameters:
        location - The location used to resolve relative paths for the root object, or null if the location is not known.
        resources - The resources used to localize the root object, or null if the root object was not localized.
        See Also:
        cellColorPicker, backgroundColorPicker, ruleInputField, resizeBoardInput, fpsInputField, numFramesInputField, chooseSizeBox, chooseDrawBox

      • drawEditorBoard

        public void drawEditorBoard()
        Method responsible for calling CanvasDrawers drawBoard() with the considerations of the quadratic nature of the editor board. Sets cell draw size relative to which ever is largest of the boards width or height.
        See Also:
        editorCanvas, Board.getWidth(), Board.getHeight(), CanvasDrawer.setCellDrawSize(double), CanvasDrawer.drawBoard(Canvas, Board, GraphicsContext, Color, Color, boolean)

      • drawStrip

        public void drawStrip()
        Method responsible for drawing the "Strip". Does a copy of the current GameOfLife object and calls CanvasDrawers drawStripBoard() method.
        See Also:
        stripBoard, gameOfLife, stripBoard, GameOfLife.clone(), GameOfLife.getPlayBoard(), CanvasDrawer.drawStripBoard(GameOfLife, Board, Canvas, Color)

      • closeClick

        public void closeClick()
        Method to exit the application. Is called when the user clicks on the "exit"-button.
        See Also:
        editorCanvas

      • resizeBoardOnEnter

        public void resizeBoardOnEnter()
        Method to resize the editor board. Since the editor board cannot be expanded by drawing such as in the main application window, the user is able to resize the board by entering a value for the number of cells of a quadratic cell grid. Should the user input an invalid value, a popup window will be shown. Another popup will show if valid, waring the user that the currently active cells will be set as inactive when resizing the board. Draws the editor and strip board after resizing.
        See Also:
        resizeBoardInput, drawEditorBoard(), drawStrip(), DynamicBoard.setGridSize(int), PopUpAlerts.resizeAlert(), PopUpAlerts.resizeClearAlert()

      • chooseCellColor

        public void chooseCellColor()
        Method to change the current cell color. Is called when the user interacts with the cell color picker. Sets the color and draws the board.
        See Also:
        currentCellColor, cellColorPicker, drawEditorBoard()

      • chooseBackgroundColor

        public void chooseBackgroundColor()
        Method to change the current background color. Is called when the user interacts with the cell color picker. Sets the color and draws the board.
        See Also:
        currentBackgroundColor, backgroundColorPicker, drawEditorBoard()

      • mousePressed

        public void mousePressed(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
        Method to be called when the user presses the mouse on the editor board, calling CanvasDrawers drawPressed() method to let the user draw active cells on the board.
        Parameters:
        mouseEvent - The event of the mouse click.
        See Also:
        drawEditorBoard(), CanvasDrawer.drawPressed(MouseEvent, Board, boolean)

      • mouseDragged

        public void mouseDragged(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
        Method to be called when the user drags the mouse on the editor board, calling CanvasDrawers drawDragged() method to let the user draw active cells on the board by dragging.
        Parameters:
        mouseEvent - The event of the mouse drag.
        See Also:
        drawEditorBoard(), CanvasDrawer.drawDragged(MouseEvent, Board, boolean)

      • mouseDragOver

        public void mouseDragOver()
        Method called when the user lets go of the mouse button after a drag. Calls CanvasDrawers mouseDragOver() method and draws the strip board again.
        See Also:
        drawStrip(), CanvasDrawer.setEraseFalse()

      • clearBoardClick

        public void clearBoardClick()
        Method called when the user clicks the clear board button. Calls Boards reset board and makes all cells inactive, before drawing both the editor board and the strip.
        See Also:
        drawEditorBoard(), drawStrip(), Board.resetBoard()

      • toggleGridClick

        public void toggleGridClick()
        Method called when the user clicks the grid button. Lets the user choose between having the grid drawn on the board or not. Sets the boolean as opposite of its value and draws the editor board.
        See Also:
        grid, drawEditorBoard()

      • setRules

        public void setRules()
        Method called when the user presses enter within the rule text-box. Tries to set the rules of the gameOfLife with the input in the text field, and produces a warning if it fails.
        See Also:
        ruleInputField, drawStrip(), GameOfLife.setRuleString(String), PopUpAlerts.ruleAlert2()

      • chooseSizeClick

        public void chooseSizeClick()
        Method called when the user interacts with the gif-size choice box. Consists of a switch statement that sets the gifSize according to what the user has selected.
        See Also:
        chooseSizeBox, gifSize

      • chooseDrawClick

        public void chooseDrawClick()
        Method called when the user interacts with the chooseDrawBox choice box. Consists of a if-else statement that sets a boolean according to what the user has selected, and is responsible for whether the GIF exported should include the entire board, or just the active pattern.
        See Also:
        chooseDrawBox, drawEntireBoard

      • saveRLEClick

        public void saveRLEClick()
        Method called when the user clicks the export RLE button. Trims the pattern down to its bounding box ensuring that unnecessary lines are not included, calls FileHandler's patternExportToString() and stringToRLE() methods to create an encoded RLE string of the pattern and splits it up into lines of 70 characters for presentation. Lets the user choose a file path to save the RLE-file to, and calls FileHandlers RLEtoDisk() with all relevant metadata text-boxes as parameters to save the RLE. Produces a warning for the user if the export fails.
        See Also:
        Board.getBoundingBox(), Board.trim(), GameOfLife.getRuleString(), FileHandler.patternExportToString(byte[][]), FileHandler.stringToRLE(String), FileHandler.RLEtoDisk(File, int, int, String, TextField, TextField, CheckBox, TextArea, String), PopUpAlerts.ioeSaveError()

      • saveGifClick

        public void saveGifClick()
        Method called when the user clicks the export GIF button. Does several checks on the value of the input fields, to check that they are valid, producing a warning if not. Gathers statistics for 50 iterations to check if there is a high probability of the pattern repeating itself, and asks the user if they want to use that number of iterations to potentially create a endless loop. Creates a new GifConstructor object with the relevant data, and calls exportGif() to write the gif file to disk.
        See Also:
        drawEntireBoard, gifSize, numFramesInputField, fpsInputField, gameOfLife, Board.getWidth(), Board.getHeight(), PopUpAlerts.sizeBoardError(), PopUpAlerts.gifFramesAlert(), PopUpAlerts.gifFPSAlert(), PopUpAlerts.gifSimilarityAlert(int), Statistics.getStatistics(GameOfLife, int), Statistics.getHighestSimilarity(int[][]), GameOfLife.clone(), GifConstructor.GifConstructor(GameOfLife, int, int, boolean, Color, Color, int), GifConstructor.exportGif(String)

      • setExportBoard

        public void setExportBoard(Board board)
        Method to set the current exportBoard object to that of the parameter.
        Parameters:
        board - The new board to be set.
        See Also:
        exportBoard

        Parameters:

        See Also:
